...for all those "Euro newcomers". And they're trying actively to strike keynote of EU policy. And this keynote reeks a lot with radicalism, xenophobia and racialism.  Such anti-Semites as Polish biologist Maciej Giertych has been inspired by Estonian example. He had conscience to present his essay 'Civilizations at war in Europe' in EU Parliament hall. Well, I think it is time we do something to Estonia. As a result of EU's let-alone principle, in this country there took place a rigged parliamentary election - if to choose my words carefully - that enabled neo-fascists and nationalist zealots consolidate their grip of authority. On March 26, the ruling coalition will get formed in the Riigikogu and it is easy to guess what party members it will be consisting of. At last, fascists will be able to gain revenge in an individually taken country, while the consequences promise to be deplorable for the whole European Union. We relied fondly on Estonian social democrats but they turned out to be as fascist-minded as members of ResPublica and the Reform party of Estonia - that is why many members of the Social Democratic party voted in favor of the law enabling removal of the monument to liberators of Europe from the Nazi Germany. Well, it looks like time to apply some measures to Estonia. The harsher the sanctions, the better for Estonia itself and EU as such. Just don't shelve the motion, right?

post_info.post_title: Well, I think it is time we do something to Estonia

won't surprise if you even haven't heard anything about the conflict around the Soviet memorial demolition. Many European Internet friends of mine don't know that there is such totalitarian state like Estonia is member of EU for our government tries to suppress gossip about it.
 And at the same time I was on Tonismagi Hill among memorial defenders in April 26 and brought group of my friends there. Police brutally suppressed the demonstrators. You know after that meeting two strange fellows invited me persistently to cafe. There they've in quite clear and polite terms explained me that if I continue such 'antisocial activity' and publicly express my opinion then I'd be very sorry about it. Also I shouldn't talk much on this topic on phone. 'Think about your future and future of your parents.' - said they to me. Some of my friends had similar conversations.
 Now I'm ashamed but I was so scared by this talk that didn't try to prevent demolition of the memorial. And it is clear our authorities stacked at special services too. And I don't doubt that in case of active resistance there will be much more victims of police arbitrariness.

Estonia is becoming dangerously militant in her drive to rewrite WWII history. The demolition of the monument to Soviet warriors in the capital of Estonia is just the beginning. We swallowed it. What now? Poland is in the same boat with Estonia. There are already cries there to go same path and make Poland free of any Soviet monuments. Those are not just words. Both countries are full of ambitious and claim some territories in European lands. They want the European space to be reshaped. And Tallinn wants money to patch up its economy. Estonian officials have already raised the possibility of USA and Britain paying them some WWII compensations!! That's blackmailing. You know blackmailers are usually ready for everything. Some extremist groups may act as terrirsts to achieve the set goals. Estonia and Poland must be shown their place in Europe, the sooner the better.

Last Thursday and Friday in Tallinn, Estonia, Estonian special police force showed how cruel it can be dispersing a small crowd of Russian Estonians who were protesting against humiliating removal of a WWII memorial to Russian soldiers - defeaters of fascism. In order to 'pacify' some 700 Russian protesters (mainly elderly men and women with their teenage sons and daughters), over 3,500 policemen dressed up fit to kill were gathered at the Tхnismдgi Square equipped with full body armor, helmets, rubber truncheons, electric shockers, tear gas sprays and handguns loaded with live rounds, not rubber ones as they should be in such cases. It looked like Estonian authorities feared that this small number of defenders of the Soviet monument would no less than overthrow a government or start an 'orange revolution' there. When violent clashes started, it became clear that Estonian policemen were instructed to show no mercy to protesters. They pulled protesters out from the crowd one by one and beat them up by twos and threes with no respect to gender or age of the victim. I saw with my own eyes how one of Estonian police machos stroke down to the ground an elderly woman who was standing nearby shouting 'Shame to Estonia!' and began to kick her with his boots. Damn, it was monstrous!!!! About 100 protesters got beaten up, their faces bleeding, their arms and legs broken. At least five protesters got killed, over 300 were arrested. At last, Estonian government showed us its savage face! In the respect of this event, I wonder why there was not a single European newspaper that gave an unembellished coverage of the inhumane massacre that took place right in the center of Estonian capital? Europeans must be aware that tyranny is rising up in Estonia as well as heroizing fascism. EU must do something to stop it!

Come to Tonismagi in May 8 together with us! We're mourning over nasty profanation of Soviet soldier-deliberator by Estonian government. People from the entire country and from abroad will go to Tonismagi hill for paying homage to memory of fallen warriors that resisted fascist invasion into Estonia during WW II. Now our country returns to monstrous fascist regime and we need all people of good will for resisting it! So we wait for you in May 8 on Tonismagi hill. We won't allow fascist monster strike roots in our country once again!

I heard it told that Estonian prime minister Andrus Ansip has embezzled some 2.35 mln from the money supply that had been laid out by EU for Estonia for economic advancement of that country as a new EU member-state. In order to conceal his misappropriation, Ansip worked up a disturbance in the center of Tallinn by removing old Soviet war memorial. As I see, the whole scheme worked as Ansip planned it. Russian Estonians were put in a temper by demolishing the monument that honors their grandparents who defeated fascism, and removing the relics of them. After that riots got sparkled and lasted for three days until they were severely suppressed by Estonian special police forces. Yes, it was a real massacre as far as I could estimate. It has accused Russia of waging cyberattacks against Estonian government sites. And now head of Estonian Defense agency urges Brussels to see such attacks as hostile military activities. Have you noticed that for almost 15 years in Estonia nobody paid any attention to that notorious Soviet memorial? But right before summit Russia-EU in Samara suddenly this monument had become irritant for Estonian authority. That smells provocation. For sure Ansip knew that such behavior would rouse indignation in Russia and among Estonian national minorities. And isn't it suspicious that very US lackey Estonia that can't do anything without American instructions boosted that nasty fuss? It was quite clear whose side EU would take.
 There are already notes in such European editions as The European Voice and Daily Telegraph that EU 'has become anxious about exacerbation of relations with Russia and doesn't leave out possibility of prohibition of its joining WTrO (World Trade Organization) and of postponing summit Russia-EU.
 This means just that US don't need strong Russia and Europe and more less they need in co-operating Russia and Europe. So they press towards to introduce split between those two political forces. Besides they by such means they wanted to discredit both Russia and Germany which is in the chair of EU now. IMHO Europeans should defy such provocations. This one wasn't first and wasn't last. Thus another US henchman Poland supported Estonia and continues stirring trouble.

Three or four years ago when Baltic countries were preparing to join EU international experts warned European Union that those countries are sponsored by USA and would carry out policy for sake of White House. Experts also said that Russophobe moods are prevailing in Baltic and East European countries like Poland and expressed their misgiving that other EU countries might be infected with it. Europeans disregarded jauntily considering that they'll manage this problem easily. But experts were right. Now anti-Russian stereotypes are much stronger in Europe than 3 or 4 years ago. Our Baltic and East European neighbours had accustomed themselves to their new status of EU member rather quickly. And now they've begun setting pace to European policy. It is quite possible that results of summit RF-EU going on in Samara would be quite negative for Europe. For with such position we could easily loose one of most profitable economical partners. And that would fault of Old Europe, which allows American fifth column dictating their opinion to entire EU.
